titles.title: National Flood Insurance Program Reextension Act of 2010
National Flood Insurance Program Reextension Act of 2010
National Flood Insurance Program Reextension Act of 2010
National Flood Insurance Program Reextension Act of 2010
A bill to extend the National Flood Insurance Program until September 30, 2011.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Ms. Waters moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3814.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/30/2010--Public Law. National Flood Insurance Program Reextension Act of 2010 - Amends the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 to extend the National Flood Insurance Program from September 30, 2010, through September 30, 2011. Continues through FY2011 the authority of the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), with the President's approval, to issue up to $20.725 billion in notes and obligations to finance the Program.
